data.title: Pleasant Hotel - Good Value
data.text: I visited family in Santa Clara and stayed at this hotel for five days. The room was very clean, attractive, and comfortable.   The room had a coffee maker, a microwave and a small refrigerator.  Nice Fitness Center. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for such a great review! Sounds like we really hit all the right things for you - we look forward to serving you next time you come to see your family!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Attending conference at Santa Clara Conference Center
data.text:
Chose the hotel because it was reasonably priced versus other listed hotels close to the conference center. 
The rooms were clean and well kept- but they are outside entrances which I'm not crazy about from a general safety standpoint. However, the location of the hotel seemed to be in a safe area. 
It's about a 10-15 minute ride to the conference center- and about $10-15 Uber cost. 
The breakfast was a nice buffet- and was well stocked by the friendly staff.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for responding - every review and comment is welcome.

Judging by the scores you gave, we did pretty well except for the fact that we are an exterior corridor property. I am wondering what we could have done beyond that to improve your score for next time?

Thanks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Better choice in the area
data.text: We moved here from another hotel in the area that was noisy and seemed shady.  This hotel was clean and quieter.  Even though on a busy street, the rooms are back off the street and protected from noise.  The bathroom is small.  The drain didn't close in mine, for those who like a tub.

data.title: Good value
data.text:
Stayed for five days, good breakfast, friendly staff. There is a refrigerator , microwave, lots of channels to choose from a pool with handicap accessibility, my only complaint was the sheets were not changed the entire time.
Other than that it was a very nice stay.

data.title: Best of Best
data.text: Loved this place!! Location, room, cleanliness, all perfect for a business stay. There are endless places to eat in the area. The staff are all polite and look like they enjoy  their jobs. The pool and exercise room were well kept. Breakfast was great; options for all eaters. The room was modern and spotless.  Love that they clean the tv remote!  It's all in the details. As a female traveling alone, I felt very safe. The bed and bedding were very comfortable.

data.title: Another Amazing Stay at BW University Inn
data.text: This is definitely my favorite hotel in the area.  The front desk staff are all wonderful and so very helpful.  The breakfast selection is very good, and it is stocked often.  The fact that it is about a block away from a small shopping center with a Target and a Walgreens is a bonus!

data.title: Pleasant Suprise
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the service and comfort at this property.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Staff was very helpful and kind.  Breakfast was wonderful and well serviced.  Overall a very good choice!

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Jason,

Thanks for the high praise! We look forward to serving you next time!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent for the price
data.text: Clean, adequate space, friendly service at front desk, accommodating. Pleasant and great for the moderate price.  Very good breakfast.  Need to prepare your own toast etc.  Good coffee.  Quite environment even though its on a main road.

data.title: Decent stay
data.text: Fairly pricey. The room was pretty, but the bathroom cramped. The pool was a nice set-up with a bathroom- no showers or heat. Breakfast was nice. Santa Clara was only a short drive to San Jose which our family loves. We were able to easily go visit the Tech and explore downtown.

data.title: This time it wasn't as great as the first one
data.text: I stayed in Best Western the week of August the 15th for studies and honestly I expected my experience to be as great as the first one but it wasn't. I don't why but they assigned me a room for disabled guests so taking a shower was really uncomfortable for me since I am not used to use this kind of bathrooms, I left the floor wet many times, the handwasher was closer to the floor too. Since this room was very close of the street and under the storage room, every night I heard a noise coming from above. I didn't make any complaint since I am not the kind of guest who complaints and also I was more worried about my lugagge which AA lost by mistake, fortunately a couple of days later it arrived. Marisol from the front desk as always she was very kind and she even called me when my lugagge was back, the rest of the staff is good too, but as I said I don't know why they assigned me a so uncomfortable room for me. I thought they would remember me as a returning guest but apparently they didn't.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm sorry your stay wasn't as you expected! Occasionally reservations come in from third party sites like Expedia with one of our ADA rooms requested - since the reservation came from the outside, we often cannot question the assignment. I don't know if this was your case, but we'll do our best to get it all right for you next time!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

user_location.name: São José do Rio Prêto, São Paulo, Brazil

data.title: Nicely renovated
data.text: This part of Santa Clara used to be a little run down, but it looks like the city has been cleaning things up on El Camino. In particular, this hotel used to be pretty run down (maybe 7 years ago), but it's been nicely renovated and I felt completely safe staying here. It also helps that there is a new shopping center down the street, along with new restaurants.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review, Vincent! Levi's Stadium has certainly boosted the local economy here in Santa Clara, and we're pretty happy with how the Chamber of Commerce has been responding. We appreciate your support!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: rudness of staff
data.text: when you go to to eat breakfast the staff will look and watch over you like theyre doing their food count and for you not to take more then they put out....front desk person was really nice and made up for the rest of the staff the people that checked us our were realy rude as well

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm certainly concerned to hear about your complaints. We do have issues from time to time with people helping themselves to copious amounts of food, but this shouldn't be their initial attitude. I will look into it immediately - thank you for bringing it to my attention.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Family Reunion
data.text: In the area for a family reunion, and booked a total of 7 rooms. Clean, well-appointed, excellent breakfast choices, great air conditioning, but the best part was the friendliness and cooperation of the staff with room assignments, payment options, and being excited with us about our celebration.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Those are fantastic praises! Was there any of our employees that stood out among the crowd?
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Relatively new building at quiet location
data.text: The motel-style inns by Best Western vary in quality. I liked this one. It is well designed, well kept and relatively new. It looks friendly. The pool is nice. Many rooms have windows at the rear side, so you can get some fresh air through the room. The road has many little shops and food is easy to come by. Because of the municipal centre on the neighbouring block, it is a quiet place especially in the evenings and weekends. The down town area can be easily reached by foot.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Terry,

Thank you for the review. I agree - this neighborhood lends a nice atmosphere for our guests. We look forward to serving you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Simple and quiet
data.text: The hotel is very nice and the location is very convenient. Also one thing I liked was that besides the fact my window faces to the main road (El Camino Real) the room vas very quiet and peaceful to sleep, the most important thing after a full day of work and meetings.

owner_response.author: Gavin M, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Bryan,
Thanks for the kind words. We're so glad you enjoyed the quiet - there is nothing quite like it!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Good Hotel
data.text: This hotel was one of the best I have stayed at. Very nice and new feeling. Best breakfast with fresh fruit everyday and a lot to choose from. The people at the front desk are very friendly. The only thing I would suggest is adjustable shower heads with different spray settings. The one in the room was just a light spray and I prefer a little more pressure.

owner_response.author: Tom L, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jon P,

    Thank you very much for the great review and all the positive feedback.  Thank you also for the information regarding the shower heads I will speak with maintenance and see what we can do about it.  I hope to have you stay with us again.  Regards, Tom
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Last minute accomodations
data.text: Checked a number of properties in the area as I had an early morning business meeting.  Most were extremely expensive or not in proiximity.  They not only had the best rate but the staff was very accomodating, room was clean and quiet, and I was able to get a good night's sleep + a good breakfast at an early hour.

owner_response.author: Tom L, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Scott T,

   Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of the hotel it is very much appreciated.  I am glad to see the hotel was to your like and the staff treated you well and you were able to get a good night sleep.  We welcome you back the next time you are in town. Regards, Tom
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
data.text: This hotel is a little gem - close to the university, and easy to find (not too far off a major freeway. It is on a busy road but is surprisingly quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful, the bed was very comfortable, and both the hotel and room decor were pleasant. A short but enjoyable stay.

owner_response.author: Tom L, General Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Joan C,

       Thank you for the 5 star review.  We hope you come back to see us again and I was happy to see that you found the beds comfortable and the staff friendly.  Regards, Tom
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nicely renovated property with continental breakfast
data.text:
I was surprised to see how nice this property was.  It must have been recently renovated as it looked great when we were there in July 2016.  
Room was clean with a mini fridge and a microwave which was a bonus.  
There is a salt water outdoor pool which is not heated (at least while we were there).  Free parking is available close to your room as it is a drive-up type of Motel configuration.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The cost of the room was expensive (about $300 Canadian per night), but that seems to be the going rate.

owner_response.author: Tom L, Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Grant,

   Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  I am happy to see that you were satisfied with your stay and welcome you back the next time you are in town.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Place to stay!
data.text: The outside esthetics of this place is very nice which is one reason I decided to stay there.  The staff was pleasant. Offered warm breakfast (not just a continental). The room was very clean and nice. This hotel had reachable plugs next to the bed to plug in your phone( many hotels don't have that).. They even have a lift next to the pool for any handicap person to go into the pool.  That  is fantastic.!  Best place I stayed during my entire travel.

owner_response.author: Tom L, Manager at BEST WESTERN University Inn Santa Clara, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Karen R,

   I am glad to see you like the look of the hotel and the guest rooms were up to your standards.  We hope to have you stay with us again if you are ever in town.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
